document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the southern African species of the subgenus Creightonella Cockerell (Apoidea: Megachilidae: Megachile Latreille)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the southern African species of the subgenus Creightonella Cockerell (Apoidea: Megachilidae: Megachile Latreille)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Discussion.
Smith ( 1853 )
described this species from the Cape of Good Hope. Otherwise it is known from the northern parts of southern African, and areas further north, making the type locality questionable. The holotype was studied.
Friese ( 1903 )
described it as
sexdentata
, a name preoccupied by Robertson ( 1895 ).
Cockerell ( 1931 )
therefore proposed the replacement name hexadentata . A syntype of s exdentata Friese has been studied.
Pasteels ( 1965 )
synonymized
cognata
and
sexdentata
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1a–d.
Megachile cognata
. a. Female face. b. Female habitus. c. Male face. d. Male habitus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cockerell ( 1908 b)
described
mitimia
, and
Pasteels ( 1965 )
synonymized
cognata
and
mitima .
The holotype of
mitima
has been studied but the head is missing and the vestiture is mostly lost.
Pasteels ( 1965 )
synonymy could therefore not be confirmed, but is accepted.

Vachal ( 1910 )
described
rufa
var. profusca
from Zambia and
Pasteels ( 1965 )
synonymized it with
cognata .
The type material has been studied and this synonymy is confirmed.
Friese ( 1915 )
described
rufa
var. claripennis
. The synonymy of
claripennis
with
cognata
is here proposed, following the study of the type material.
Friese ( 1921 )
described
natalensis
from South Africa . The type material has been studied and the male syntypes are
M. schulthessi
, the female syntype is
M. cognata .
Donald Baker labelled the female syntype of
natalensis
from Kwa- Zulu-Natal (‘Krantzkloof’) as the lectotype of this species but did not publish this designation. It is here designated. He also indicated that the type series of
natalensis
is composite.
Pasteels ( 1965 )
made
natalensis
a subspecies of
congruens
. Study of the type found this to be incorrect and it is here synonymized with
cognata
.
Friese ( 1922 )
described
arnoldi
from Zimbabwe . The holotype has not been studied. It was synonymized with
ikuthaensis
by
Pasteels ( 1965 )
, here a junior synonym of
cognata .
Cockerell ( 1933 d)
described
calloleuca
and later (
Cockerell 1937
) replaced this name with
calloleucops
because the former name was preoccupied by an American species described by Cockerell ( 1922 ).
Cockerell ( 1933 e)
described both
lomamiensis
and
platyura
.
Pasteels ( 1965 )
synonymized
cognata , calloleucops , lomamiensis
and
platyura
. The type material has been studied and these synonymies are confirmed.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Biology.
Megachile cognata
has been recorded on flowers of
Mentha
sp.

Material examined. Type material. Female holotype of
Megachile cognata : ‘
Type , B.M.
TYPE
HYM. 17a 2198 ,
Megachile cognata

male Fr. 1900 Friese det., Type , Coll. Friese, Zool. Mus Berlin,
Creightonella mitimia
det Ister’, [
